view.label: Browse mzTab Result Files- Top K
Browse mzTab Result Files- Library construction inputs

column.label: "One-Hit Wonders"
column.tooltip: Proteins identified by exactly one peptide.

column.label: PTMs
column.tooltip: Spectrum identifications, grouped by unique sets of post-translational modifications.

column.label: "One-Hit Wonders"
column.tooltip: Proteins identified by exactly one peptide.

column.label: PTMs
column.tooltip: Spectrum identifications, grouped by unique sets of post-translational modifications.

column.label: "One-Hit Wonders"
column.tooltip: Proteins identified by exactly one peptide.

column.label: PTMs
column.tooltip: Spectrum identifications, grouped by unique sets of post-translational modifications.

column.label: PSM ID
column.tooltip: PSM ID from within the source MzTab file

column.label: Peak List File
column.tooltip: The name of the peak list file from which this spectrum came, as referenced from within the source MzTab file

column.label: Index
column.tooltip: Spectrum index (0-based) in the file.

column.label: Scan
column.tooltip: Spectrum scan number

column.label: Peptide
column.tooltip: The modified peptide sequence matched to this spectrum

column.label: Modifications
column.tooltip: The positions and accessions of all post-translational modifications found for this spectrum identification

column.label: Protein
column.tooltip: The accession of the protein matched to this spectrum

column.label: Charge
column.tooltip: Precursor ion charge

column.label: Search Engine
column.tooltip: Search engine used to generate this identification

column.label: Valid
column.tooltip: If a spectrum could not be found in the source peak list file, or if the identification contains any ambiguous PTM references, then it will be marked as "INVALID".

column.label: PSM ID
column.tooltip: PSM ID from within the source MzTab file

column.label: Filename
column.tooltip: Spectrum file name

column.label: Index
column.tooltip: Spectrum index (1-based) in the file. The first spectrum has index 1, the second has index 2, and so on. For mzXML files this value is same as the scan number.

column.label: Scan
column.tooltip: Spectrum scan number

column.label: FragMethod
column.tooltip: Fragmentation method

column.label: Peptide
column.tooltip: Peptide sequence with neighboring amino acids

column.label: Protein
column.tooltip: Protein name

column.label: Charge
column.tooltip: Precursor ion charge

column.label: Score
column.tooltip: MS-GF raw score of the peptide-spectrum match

column.label: DB P-Value
column.tooltip: Probability that a spectrum matches a random database with a score equal to or exceeding the observed score

column.label: FDR
column.tooltip: False discovery rate

column.label: PepFDR
column.tooltip: Peptide-level false discovery rate estimated using the target-decoy approach

column.label: SpecProb
column.tooltip: Probability that a spectrum matches a random peptide with a score equal to or exceeding the observed score
